Reviews.Title: “Hotel Tivoli, great, as always!”
Reviews.Author: seeker141
Reviews.Content: Returned to the Tivoli this past September. Located in S. Toma, just a 3 minute walk from the vaporetto stop, it is a great spot from which to venture out into the city. I would recommend reserving an upper room facing the courtyard. (Stairs only) This lends for a quieter room with a nice morning view through the shuttered windows. Breakfast is just fine... has an abundance of fresh cold cuts cereals, bread, jam, & a pretty decent cappuccino. Staff does a great job all the way around. Great support at the front desk, service and housekeeping as well. The main thing about this place is location & accommodation. Both are great...just minutes from just about anywhere... e.g. 10 minutes from the Academia, 10 minutes from Piazzo San Giacomo, 3 minutes to Campo S. Toma. & minutes from a great chichetti in any direction. Weather is perfect during this time of year. Would also recommend having lunch on the Fondamenta Nuove. Great views Murano/Cemetery etc... situated right on the water! Spectacular.. all the action is on the water, so its nice...no crowds. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Other sites less expensive”
Reviews.Author: henricus v
Reviews.Content: I finally decided not to book via Tripadvisor as your prices for this Hotel Tivoli in Venice were higher than two other sites. Otherwise the Hotel was fine : we satayed several nights with four couples. Location is good. The family-run personnel is friendly.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel tivoli”
Reviews.Author: jmeyersforeman
Reviews.Content: great budget hotel, in a great area, close enough to the train station to walk to the hotel, and if necessary drag your luggage over a couple of bridges. close enough to the the main tourist attractions to see everything, far enough out of the way to be quiet and authentic. close to some great piazza's to feel like the real Venice not just the tourist Venice. the room was clean and bright on the third floor with a separate bathroom, and over looked the courtyard. service was excellent, staff was friendly, and it had a family feeling. breakfast was continental style, we were up and gone by 6 am to see the sunrise at St. Mark's Square and missed breakfast....... the sunrise was worth it. We were able to store our luggage at the hotel on an early arrival, and on a late checkout. We would happily stay there again. www.jmeyersforeman.wordpress.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JERVancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a fantastic, easy-to-find location. The room (a triple on the first floor) was clean, comfortable and a good size. We stayed here during a very hot spell in September, but had great air conditioning in our room. In fact I found myself longing to get back to the room when trying to make our way through the crowds in the heat. Breakfast was a typical European continental breakfast, but we really enjoyed taking our meal in the charming courtyard. Staff was friendly and helpful, happy to let us drop our bags first thing in the morning after arriving on an overnight train and use their washrooms to freshen up. Same on the way out, it was great to be able to leave our bags at the hotel until our 11:00pm train left. All in all, I would say this hotel is great value for Venice and would not hesitate to recommend to anyone looking to be comfortable on a slightly tighter budget.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel for me...”
Reviews.Author: JohnDCM
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for three nights at this hotel with a small academic arts group from Greece. I found the lodging to be clean, neat, friendly and affordable in a city that is known for its expensive lodging and food. The location is convenient to all of Venice but far enough off the beaten track to be quiet at night. The breakfast is standard continental fair--nothing special, but nonetheless adequate for any traveler on a budget and wanting to stock up for the day and skip lunch. The coffee was also very good and the woman on duty took my order with a pleasant demeanor. The front desk was very helpful with any of my questions, patient with my lack of Italian and willing to go the extra mile. I recommend this hotel to anyone, solo, with groups, the elderly (no elevator) or families.

Reviews.Title: “A room with the perfect view”
Reviews.Author: MichaelW_Sydney
Reviews.Content: There are so many different areas you could stay in Venice, and this hotel was in the location that is my pick for the best of the best. Not too busy and crowded, yet central to everything. Felt a little like a community of real people and real business operating in what can be an overly touristic city. Our room (travelling as a couple) was impressive ...... bright, clean, spacious and with the perfect view over their courtyard (al fresco or inside breakfast areas available). Venice is a romatic city and coming back to such a lovely room each night ... well, i am still smiling at the memories. Breaskfast (included) was very nice, and being able to lesiurely hang out in the lovely courtyard over coffee is a great way to starty a busy day. The staff here are fantastic ... the couple that run the place were helpful and very friendly. There is a computer for your use and helpful hints at the ready. I will certainly be staying at Tivoli next time i am lucky enough to be in Venice M.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: potatofish
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed was small but had a cute little balcony and good area, a bit more off the beaten path of mobs of tourists. Staff nice and helpful. Quite a walk w/suitcases over several bridges w/ steps to get there!

Reviews.Title: “Well located, excellent room, nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: giemeigi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a walking distance from the train station, located is a really quiet place, which is good because is far away from the crowd. The room was very good, clean and beautiful; the bathroom was realy clean, with good towels and room service. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accomodations at value pricing in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WICorgis
Reviews.Content: Venice was the most expensive city we stayed in during our visit to Italy. We arrived by air and left by train. We wanted to stay IN Venice (as opposed to Mestre), and Hotel Tivoli fit the bill nicely. Breakfast was great, and the location in Dorsoduro made it easy to park our luggage, see the city, return for check in, see the city, return for a nap, etc. Room was clean & relatively quiet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: dutchbuis
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. it is a great location. 10 to 15 minutes walk from trainstation and to st marks square. the hotel was clean. the shower a bit small but that is minor. the staff is very very nice. would stay here again next time we are in venice. and there are some great restaurants near the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: renrick
Reviews.Content: Great Location- walk to everything. Beds were uncomfortable but ok for a few nights- we had 4 twins in one good sized room. Somewhat noisey at night - but it is to be expected in the alley ways of Venice. Bathrooms nice- clean. Breakfast was minimal but great. Venture out to find the good restaurants !!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Bellamisio
Reviews.Content: In short, I would stay here again. Breakfast: It was quite good including bread, meat, cheese, fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. Room: Our room was cleaned every day, it faced onto the street so with the windows open it was a bit noisy but closing the windows made the room quite quiet (I'm a light sleeper and had no problems). The double bed consisted of two single beds put together but this was something we had gotten used as it was the same in all other hotels we've stayed in while in Italy. The pillows were comfortable, there were extra pillows and blankets. Also, the room had its own temperature control which included air conditioning. Bathroom: In suite, quite spacious over all but the shower stall itself is on the small size. Room service replaced towels daily. Decent location, close to the St Toma vaparetto stop but in Venice, everything is within walking distance :) Over all, the hotel was clean and well maintained. Oh, and free WiFi which worked at a good speed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, inexpensive, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Casbeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided us with somewhere clean and reasonably convenient to lay our heads while on a short visit to Venice. This is about as far as I would go in recommending it. The rooms were quite small, but the bedrooms and bathrooms were clean, and the beds comfortable. Unfortunately, the breakfast was not as appetising as the pictures showed. They provided the usual continental breakfast, but quality and choice was very poor. Free internet connection was useful for pre-flight check-in. The air-conditioning was excellent, especially as we visited in the height of summer. Location was good - only a few minutes walk from the nearest Vaporetto stop, and only about 10/15 min walk from Piazzale Roma, the main bus stop. (The train station is just next door to the bus station, so again, quite convenient.) In summary, if your hotel is an important part of your visit to Venice, I would not recommend this hotel. However, if you just want a clean hotel at a reasonable price, where you can just sleep between sight-seeing days, then Hotel Tivoli is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Okay no frill hotel”
Reviews.Author: christy1030
Reviews.Content: I researched and emailed probably 30 - 50 hotels and this was the best value for a hotel on the island. It was only 58 euros and included breakfast and air conditioning. The shared bathroom was a much better experience than I expected. It was clean and I never had to wait to use it. There are sinks in the room so that was helpful. The rooms however were pretty small and outdated. The a/c wasn't super cold and the comforter had some cigarette burns and the walls had some smashed bugs. A new coat of paint would really help. I was happy with the breakfast. There were a lot of options. The computer with internet didn't work and no one could fix it which was disappointing. The owner let us drop off our suitcase before our room was ready and leave it the day we left but don't leave anything valuable because it sits unguarded in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: cait011
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay for my 3 days in Venice. It's located pretty close to the St. Toma vaporetto stop and is fairly close to several different sights that we visited, including Accademia, Peggy Guggenheim, Rialto market/bridge. The staff were all really friendly. The room we stayed in was a little small but still a great price. Plus, the cost included air conditioning and free wifi. The wifi was only in the lobby and patio area but still pretty convenient. Our bathroom was located in the hall, but our room had a sink and mirror in it. Sharing the bathroom was not a big deal at all, and I never had to wait to use it or anything. The breakfast in the morning was pretty good (cereal, milk, yogurt, different breads, ham, cheese, orange juice), and the staff brought out fresh coffee. Overall, this was a great place to stay. Pretty good location, reasonably priced, quiet, and just a really cute place with a lot of character. Also, it's located in the Dorsoduro sestiere which is a great place to just wonder around in general. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean, Great value, recommended”
Reviews.Author: dedicatedtraveller1
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel, close to all in the heart of Venice. Super clean and comfortable. For a small hotel I had expected some neighbour noise, but it was very very quiet. It was only at breakfast that I realized the hotel was actually full. Breakfast was very good and well presented, sufficient variety for all tastes. Efficient and friendly staff speaking good English which is wonderful seeing I don't speak any Italian. Free WIFI which was fabulous seeing I needed to catch up on email communication. THe hotel also has a computer available for its guests to use. Overall a great hotel, definite recommendation, good value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Victoriangirl
Reviews.Content: As a woman travelling alone I found this gem of a hotel to be quiet, well located, safe and very reasonable. 32 Euros for tiny but spotless single room with twin bed, desk and sink in room. Bathroom was right next door with toilet and shower stall, complete with door! Never saw or heard another soul on the floor. About 7 minute walk to train station or Piazalle Roma (bus station), hotel map from internet made it easy to find. About 3 minute walk to San Toma vaporetto stop. Although I didn't walk from hotel to San Marco, I would guess it's about 20 minutes. Lots of shops, bars, restaurants in immediate area. Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating, spoke good English. Breakfast was ample and tasty, served in a lovely breakfast room. Although it poured with rain during my stay, there was a really nice private courtyard that would be perfect during warmer and drier weather. Hotel website shows accurate pictures. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Offers a lot of value in expensive Venice”
Reviews.Author: Le6
Reviews.Content: Tivoli hotel was clean and comfortable and offered a good breakfast that was definitely worth waking up for (considering how expensive Venice can be). The service was great, and there was free Internet. The staff were friendly and helpful. Just so you know, the shower was the sort that gets the whole bathroom floor soaking wet, but it wasn't a big deal to us - and you'll find that all over Europe. Also, the hotel offers a nice little courtyard. The location was great, although considering its Venice - you're bound to get lost anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with the kids”
Reviews.Author: lonepine101
Reviews.Content: Not expensive, and well located. Room had double and 2 single beds, bathroom and AC, overlooking a quiet backstreet. Not far from water-bus stop. Breakfast included. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Venice terms”
Reviews.Author: Smilerneil
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a short weekend and wanted a cheap hotel close to many of the attractions. The Tivoli Hotel is well located a few minutes walk from the S. Tomas waterbus stop, perfect for getting around Venice without having to stay in the main tourist traps. The hotel is small, as was the room, as you'd expect in Venice, but it was clean and tidy. The staff were helpful and there was no charge to leave luggage after check-out which I understand some hotels do apply. Breakfast was plentiful, and overall for the price I suggest its a good value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in the entire trip - management threatened to call cops!!!”
Reviews.Author: rshergil
Reviews.Content: The air-conditioning in the room wasn't working at night, and when we complained to the person at the front desk, he said that he does not know anything about it, and cannot fix it. We asked him to confirm that it wasn't working by coming to our room, and he refused to do that as well. He said that we should talk to the management in the morning and get some discount for our inconvenience. He did have another room available, but he refused to shift us, and asked to be paid more for it. In the morning when we talked to the management, they basically called us liars, and said that if the air was working when we checked in, and it stopped working at night, it's not their problem!! As long as it was working in the morning, they are not liable for anything that happens after that. she also threatened to call the cops on us for asking for the discount that the guy at night said that we should get in the morning. At this point we just paid the money to get it over with. Also the promised internet does not work. The service was out more than 90% of the time that we were there. Overall, a very bad experience. I had gone there based on the reviews that I read here, but I guess people were not traveling during hot months when air conditioning is critical. And also did not have to deal with the management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, should have a higher rating”
Reviews.Author: cd1952
Reviews.Content: Booked back in December after reading good reviews from other visitors. Rooms (and loos) are clean, staff are very helpful and friendly, we were not disturbed by any noise even though there is a path just in front of the hotel. The air conditioning was very welcome. The hotel in away from the mayhem of St Marks square, but there must be about a dozen squares within about 10 minutes walk all with many restaurant in them and numerous shops. The water bus stop is 5 mins away and a traggheto across the Grand Canal (0.50 euro trip in a gondola). Good breakfast, as well, ready for walking around Venice. It was a great 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Dosoduro”
Reviews.Author: Clugg
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is superb value for money. A five minute walk from Piazzale Roma that takes you into the heart of Venice. The rooms are wonderful and there is a delightful small courtyard to eat breakfast in or just sit out and read in during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: TartanBadger
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed in their 'twin without bath', and, for Venice, were very impressed by the value. Our room was a bit small and unexciting, but at 72 euros was far less expensive than most anywhere else in Venice. The bathroom was located just down the stairs. Not sure how many rooms we shared the bathroom with, but it was never crowded when we wanted to use it. Breakfast was good (and plentiful), and they didn't mind if we stayed a bit after the official breakfast time. Helpful desk staff, though not all of them speak English very well. We stored our luggage from checkout time until 10pm for free and without any issues. Rooms facing the street might be a bit noisy because there are some restaurants a few blocks away, but we had no noise problems at all. It's very easy to find them from the train station or Piazzale Roma - only 2-3 bridges to cross and about 10-15 minutes' walk (ask them to provide you with a map). It's very close to the San Toma vaporetto stop as well.

Reviews.Title: “very helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: luckykansan
Reviews.Content: Staff went above and beyond to help us in a predicament we got ourselves into. Also saw that they did the same for a lady who stopped in trying to find her way to another hotel. So, overall, very helpful staff. Hotel is very nice and clean, and the breakfast was unreservedly generous. We had a great stay. Also, we brought our little boy along for the ride, and he was very well received :-). In a word, the hotel and its staff were very gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: Snail_climbing_Fuji
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night while waiting for friends to arrive and move into a shared apartment. My single room with bath was small, but clean and quiet. Everything worked perfectly. The breakfast buffet was copious. Staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurant they recommended for an informal meal (Trattoria Da Silva) was good. There are several walkways with the name San Pantalon. The hotel is almost on the corner of the Crosera San Pantalon and the Calle Larga Foscari. If you are walking from Piazzale Roma, get on the Saliz San Pantalon and then keep going over the next bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: IndplsTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Tivoli is a good budget choice (70E for a single with a bathroom) in a very expensive city. The plusses: clean (though small) room, comfortable bed, nice garden area, friendly staff (though I did not ask them for any "concierge" type services, so not sure how helpful they'd be), decent breakfast (each room is assigned its own table in the breakfast room, which I though was quaint). Really liked the location: pleasant 10-15 walk from both Rialto and San Marco, quiet neighborhood not totally touristy, close to Vaporetto stop, lots of restaurants and cafes nearby (Campo Santa Margherita and Campo San Barnaba are both great places to hang out with lots of choices to eat, drink, and snack) - don't miss Tonolo, an absolutely wonderful bakery just down the street. Easy walk from the train station with only one bridge after the Grand Canal (go left after you cross the Grand Canal, then left again just before the Public Gardens). The negatives: a few hearty hold-out mosquitos (in October) were about it. Don't expect anything particularly fancy, but I enjoyed my stay and thought it offered a good price in an expensive city. 10% discount if you pay in cash rather than credit card. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Tourist Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelshow
Reviews.Content: Everything was good at this Hotel, nothing was great, but everything was good. It is located in a residential area in Dorsoduro, nearby resterants, ATM's, & markets. The San Toma Vaparetto stop is just 200 yards from the Hotel. The Staff was friendly & helpful, the rooms are large, as are the bathrooms, the furniture is old, but the rooms have A/C. The hotel features a lovely breakfast room, including a garden terrace. The breakfast itself is average, sweet rolls, toast, cereal, canned fruit, yogurt, coffee & juice. The only catch is the lack of an elevator, Venice is a walking town, and after a day of sightseeing ,hiking up three flights of stairs is not my idea of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Some things you need to know earlier.”
Reviews.Author: Kostmar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Tivoli hotel for one night at the 6th of August. A point that certainly needs to be mentioned is that the hotel door closes at 1am! This was really dissapointing, and future guests must have it in mind. Also keep also in mind that you have to leave the room and deliver the key to the reception until the latest 10.30am. Generally, the hotel is 10-15 minutes walk from the main attractions. The room was slightly spacious, a little bit noisy but seemed clean enough. The double bed was actually 2 single beds joined together. Breakfast was average served in a little garden.

Reviews.Title: “Away from crowds”
Reviews.Author: natrat
Reviews.Content: Located about 5-10 minute walk from San Tomas stop or about 15-20 minutes from the station over 3 bridges if you don't have too much luggage. Rooms were quiet, clean and breakfast was good. Plenty of places to eat nearby. No elevators. No credit cards. Allowed one night stay on weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Bah”
Reviews.Author: G4Ganster
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Average breakfast. Room was decent but we got bitten by some bugs. My girlfirend was covered with bites. For the price it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrice0204
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a good location and was good value for money. The rooms are nothing special but a good size and clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good price, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: minimeli
Reviews.Content: i spent two nights in a tripe room in hotel Tivoli in feb,2007. Venice is an expensive place to visit for budget traveller and hotel tivoli offered a great stay with a fair price. The room is extremely spacious by european standard and the bathroom is well equipped,morden and provides plentiful of hot water. breakfast is of european style and basic but like any other cafes that you would visit in italy, the coffee is great! it provides a good base for exploring the city. the only draw back is stairs; loads of stairs. so keep your luggage light!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellerNottingham
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting a lot when I booked a double room and a single room, the Hotel Tivoli is classed as a 2 star hotel but the welcome we received and the overall comfort of the hotel was above and beyond many 3 star hotels I have stayed at in the past. The single room was small but it met the needs of my mother who found the room comfortable and the ensuite bathroom was very clean and a good size. My husband and I were given a double room next door which was a lot bigger than we expected, previous reports have stated the rooms are small but we did not find this to be the case. The bathroom was a very good size and overall the room was 10 times better than a 3 star hotel room which we stayed at in Paris. I ate breakfast only once but it was well presented and there was a choice of cereal, juice, croissants, yoghurt and bread. There was also some biscuits and french toast with jams and honey. The coffee was lovely and my mother who ate breakfast every day said it was always nice. The location of the hotel was amazing, less than a 10 minute from the bus station and only about 15 minutes from St. Marks square. There is an Irish bar on the corner and another bar right next door. Both were lively but the noise did not reach our rooms and it was nice to have somewhere close at hand to have a drink each night. We ate at 2 local restarants and found the food both excellent and reasonably priced. During the day when we visited areas such as St Marks square we paid approximately 16 euros for 2 coffees and a pint of Lager, in the bars near the hotel we got 2 glasses of very nice wine and a pint of lager for 7 euros. Overall the visit to Venice was amazing and I would recommend the Hotel Tivoli to any one as it was a charming well run very clean and exceptionally well priced hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful escape; but lots of stairs!”
Reviews.Author: LizzieandIzzy
Reviews.Content: (Booked through venere) Hotel Tivoli is located in the San Pantalon area of Venice, just steps from the San Toma vaporetto stop. It is in a quaint, quiet narrow street near many shops, a couple of young people's bars (not too noisey, though), a pizzeria, a couple of great clothing stores, little restaurants, a tobacherria, and most conveniently, the San Toma stop. The San Margherita "square" (more like trapezoid) is a couple of blocks and bridges away, where you can feast on pasta or just sit, drink that fabulous Italian cofee, write postcards or read. Children of all ages live in the neighborhood and you can watch them play soccer on the square. A block away you can surreptitiously glance through the windows and see students in class at San Rocco. You honestly get a feeling that you really live in Venice when you stay at Hotel Tivoli. It is far enough away from San Marco that you can mix with the lovely Venetian local people instead of mostly tourists. I truly loved it and wished I had booked more time there. The hotel is much like the Venetian streets--lots of stairs like little bridges! So interesting--but not great if you have a lot of (or heavy) luggage. Loved the garden, which had roses blooming in mid-October, and other flowers besides. It was a wonderful, peaceful escape. I would definitely stay at Hotel Tivoli again. The price was extremely reasonable for Venice (Euro 50 per night for a single with shared bath; bath extremely clean always, shared with only 2 others whom I never saw), the staff very helpful (except for the signora serving breakfast, one morning--a little haggard and a bit brusque--not too helpful). I loved the fact that its location gave me the option of either taking the vaporetto or walking to where I wanted to go. Just one downside (for me personally--nothing to do with the hotel). I had booked a 6:15am KLM flight out of Venice. This was so stupid, I have to laugh! That meant somehow carting my (book-filled) luggage across the tiny streets and bridges in the middle of the night to get to the bus station, to get the 4:40 am bus to the airport. In the end I forfeited my last night at Tivoli and miraculously got another hotel much closer to the bus station, so I could sleep a bit longer and not get lost (in three days I got lost 5 times in Venice, and I am usually great with directions and maps).

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: SClayton
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel that was a good price, but not far from the sights. Venice is very expensive anyway and the closest we could get to the centre at a reasonable price was this hotel. Overall we were pleased - although the lady that checked us in spoke little English (we coped!). Room and bathroom were fine and clean. Breakfast was a choice of the usual continental items with a waitress politely serving tea & coffee. The hotel is about a 25 minute walk from San Marco, but what a great walk! We loved Venice and were happy with the two nights here. There is a restaurant on the corner (basic) and happily some late night bars just up the street. The riverboat station is very near too. Beware though! The bells - church bells ring at 7.30am for a while and then on & off all morning and there's an old woman opposite who had her TV on really loud - Murder She Wrote in Italian, but none of this marred our trip.

HotelInfo.Name: Tivoli Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 3838 | Crosera San Pantalon, 30123 Venice, Italy
